abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory
            with project sustainability likely. A key factor in the
            successful outcome of this first operation was the
            Government's strong commitment to the reform process in
            the financial sector. With respect to macroeconomic
            policies, the government has held firm in terms of its
            commitment to lowering inflation. More stable inflation
            during the past two years has contributed to lower
            inflation-adjusted interest rates. The strong commitment of
            the Implementing Agency, the Ministry of Finance, and the
            high degree of cooperation of the Superintendency of Banking
            were also conducive to the Program's satisfactory and
            timely results. World Bank and Borrower performances are
            both rated highly satisfactory. Findings and implications
            for subsequent operations in this series included the
            following: 1) By emphasizing legislative and regulatory
            changes in the first Operation of a Programmatic series,
            there are some benefits of scope in the design of
            conditionality across various sub-sectors, followed by
            greater attention to implementation and second generation
            reforms in subsequent operations. 2) It is more difficult to
            apply and enforce current international best practices than
            to design them: Regulators were keen to begin enforcing new
            market rate risk norms but had to provide detailed guidance
            and await the building up of internal capacity and
            competency n the supervised financial entities before the
            process could be implemented in a successful manner. 3) The
            design of new regulatory tools and the development of more
            complex rules, as part of a financial sector reform program,
            should depend on the commitment of the Government to provide
            the resources to upgrade supervisory skills as well as on a
            timetable for helping regulators become expert in
            implementing new policies and procedures. 4) A solid
            macroeconomic policy framework is essential for the
            successful implementation of a financial sector reform
            program; the Government's success in lowering inflation
            and resuming growth during the past two years has helped to
            stabilize the financial system. 5) The completion of a
            comprehensive stocktaking study of the financial sector
            emphasizing potential risks should provide an initial
            perspective on the impact of recent financial sector reforms
            and any future risks.
